shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-174ra) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-139v) I-2) Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 140r-153r) I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 153r-160r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “The Praise of Mary” (fols. 160va-170ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 170ra-174ra).
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor/owner, in the supplication formula at the end of Text I-3 (fol. 160r), has been erased; the name of Kǝflä Giyorgis has been written over it, in a secondary hand.

owners.owner: In Additio 2, only a part of the owner's name, <...> Maryam has been preserved.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been rebound with a recent synthetic thread. At that time, most probably quires A and B have been added. The leather cover is missing; its traces are visible on the inner sides of the boards. Many leaves are stained with water (esp. fols. 3r-6r, 43r-47r) and wax (throughout the Ms.). Several leaves are damaged at the edges, especially the upper ones (e.g., fols. 3-6, 157-174).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) - I፩(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11v-18v) - ፫III(10/fols. 19r-28v) – ፬IV፬(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(10/fols. 37r-46v) – VI(8/fols. 47r-54v) – VII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – VIII(8/fols. 63r-70v) – IX(10/fols. 71r-80v) – X(8/fols. 81r-88v) – XI(10/fols. 89r-98v) – XII(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 99r-108v) - XIII(10/fols. 109r-118v) – XIV(10/fols. 119r-128v) - XV(10/fols. 129r-138v) – XVI(10/fols. 139r-148v) – XVII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 5, stub after 3/fols. 149r-156v) – XVIII(10/fols. 157r-166v) – XIX(6/fols. 167r-172v) – XX(2; stub 1 after 1, stub 2, before 2/fols. 173r-174v) – B(2/fols. 175r-176v).
Quires A and B have been added later.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 161r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

margin.info: All data above are for fols. 3r-160r (Texts I-1, I-2, I-3); they are taken from fol. 4r.
Text area: 12.6 x 11.5. All data above are for fols. 160va-174vb (Texts I-4, I-5); they are taken from fol. 161r.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 3r-160r), 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 160va-174vb). Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The script is regular and uniform, with short and slightly right-sloping letters. The script shows some archaic features: - the 6th order marker of ጰ is set up on a vertical stroke and oriented to the left (s. fol. 68v) - ፩ is sometimes triangular and upwards-oriented (s., e.g., fol. 126v) - numeral ፮ looks like “compressed” numeral ፯ - the word እግዚአብሔር፡ (or እግዚእ፡), especially in the abbreviated form, is written with a ligature (e.g., fols. 119v l.12, 115r l.1, 120r l.8) - the word እስራኤል፡ is sometimes written in the abbreviated form ፳ኤል፡ (s. fol. 119v l.12). Other features: - the numeral ፪ is sometimes written with an open loop at the bottom (s., e.g, fol. 127v) - the 4th order marker of some letters (e.g., ቀ ተ ኀ የ) is diagonal and going down below the ruling - the letter ኰ has an open loop marking the 5th order(s., e.g., fol. 90v l.9) - x-cross with dashes is used several times.

ppunctuations.ppunctuation: The punctuation sign of the x-cross with dashes is frequently used, especially in the rubricated parts (titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles, at the end of the initial line of each Song).

rubrications.rubrication: Name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5; a group of two adjacent lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; two groups of adjacent lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-4; title of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5; titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; initial lines and numbers of Songs; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; doxology on fol. 160r (Text I-3); elements of punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-1 እግዝ፡ [with a ligature] for እግዚአብሔር፡ (e.g., fols. 119v l.12, 120r l.8) ለ፳ኤል፡ for ለእስራኤል፡ (fol. 119v l.12) Text I-4 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡,ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 160va-161rb) እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 161va-163ra) ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ ነዓ፡ for ነዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 164vb-166va) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ ተ፡, ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fol. 168ra-vb) ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ Text I-5 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት ወ፤ ሣ፤ ይ(ክ)፤ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ (fols. 170rb-173rb) ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The titles of Pss., written in red ink, have been revised and corrections have been written in a smaller script, in black ink: a part was added to many of them: e.g., fols. 5v, 6v, 8r, 11r, 34r; some were crossed out and a new title was introduced: fols. 10v, 19r, 29r. - Ps. 109 is wrongly numbered as 110. - Canticle 8 is wrongly numbered as 9. - The traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (s. fols. 114v-123v) have been added later, possibly in the main hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 174ra-vb: Excerpts from Mälkǝˀa Maryam “Image of Mary”.
additional.add: Fols. 174ra: ሰላም፡ ለዝክረ፡ ስምኪ፡ በመጽሐፈ፡ ሕይወት፡ ልኩዕ፤…
additional.det: Cp. ChRep no 175, p. 202. Abbreviation used: ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡

additional.cont: Fol. 174vb (below Additio 1): Ownership note (?).
additional.add: Fol. 174vb (below Additio 1): ዝመጽሐፍ፡ <…> ማርያም፡ በንዋዩ፡ ወመምህሩ፡
additional.det: The note is incomplete and the first component of the name of the person has been erased, <…> Maryam.

extras.extra: - The title of Ps. 111, bä-ʾǝntä Ḥǝzǝqyas, is written in red (with red lines above and below) in the upper margin of fol. 109v. - The word ṣälot, followed sometimes by the words lä-zä ʾabbäsä, is written in black ink (in a different hand?) in the margin at the left side of the titles and numbers of some Pss., as prayer for the one who was a sinner: e.g., fols. 12v, 19r, 32r, 37r, 107v, 123r. - Notes are written in black ink at the side of the titles of some Pss. (in a smaller script; in a different hand?), as a continuation or a part of them: e.g., fols. 10r, 11r, 19r, 37r, 58r, 74r, 78r, 112r. - Some notes (of unidentified content) written (in black ink; in a different hand?) are distributed in the upper margin of fols. 160v, 161r and 162v. Compressed script is used on fol. 135r. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 10r,13r, 21r, 30v, 40r, 51v, 57v, 59v, 62v, 71v, 108v, 112r, 124r, 142r. - Part of the line is taken down: 9v, 40v, 48r, 112v. - Omitted words or passages written interlineally: e.g., fols. 7v, 13r, 21r, 25r, 29r, 68r, 105v, 156v, 158r, 161v. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 83v, 85r, 135r, 143v, 147v. - Crude notes or doodles in recent hands, in pen and pencil, in the margins and inside the text throughout the Ms.: e.g., fols. 4r, 5v, 6r, 10v, 82r, 96r, 126v, 141r, 167v, 174r, 174v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the upper left margin of the first fol. of quires II-IV (in quire IV also on the last fol.): ፪: fol. 11r; ፫: fol. 19r; ፬: fols. 29r, 36v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the main hand and in a secondary hand in the upper margin: ዘረቡዕ: fol. 58r ዘሐሙስ: fol. 80v ዘዓርብ: fol. 110r ዘቀዳሚት, ዘቀዳ[sic]: fol. 126v ዘእኁድ:[sic]: fol. 140r (to the left) ዘሰኑይ: fol. 140r (to the right) ዘሠሉስ: fol. 141r ዘረቡዕ: fol. 144v ዘሐሙስ: fol. 147r ዘዓርብ: fol. 150r ዘቀዳሚት fol. 151r.

frames.frame: - Pss. 1-50 are separated from the remaining Pss. by a line of alternating black and red dots.
